channel.title: Commands
channel.description:
What commands does everyone think are needed in a server?
Also, what does everyone think about global chat? Should there be a ::say command that everyone can use freely? Should people need to spend GP for each message? What do you guys think would be a good way to curb all the stupid shit that is said in global chat? Should there even be global chat?

Using the ignore list allows individuals to decide when the ‘bitch’ quota has been met.

item.title: Commands
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:9, topic:526436”]I think global chat is one of those things that grows more important as the game’s population density decreases. I wouldn’t put a price on it because then you effectively lock newcomers out of it.[/quote]The price could increase with their playtime, then be capped at some amount. Alternatively, the fee can be introduced after a certain point; after they use X global messages or have played for X amount of hours.

[quote=“Lothy, post:9, topic:526436”]Perhaps player-based moderation would be key. Players, if they come across a spammer, can enter a command to vote in favour of banning him. If a certain percentage of online players vote in favour of the ban then the spammer is muted temporarily (perhaps 30 to 60 minutes). The mute could apply to the logged in account only, every player account associated with the person’s forum account, or even the IP address.
There’s the risk of abuse I suppose, but that’s always the case with ‘mark as spam’ approaches. Even if there is a miscarriage of justice though, it would be short-lived. And if certain people were obviously being victimised then perhaps some sort of exemption could be applied to their account.[/quote]I don’t think player-based moderation will work very well when action is required quickly. There are a bunch of groups that would systematically mute other groups or individuals. I can easily see people just voting to shut people up who are voicing legitimate concerns, because they don’t have all the details.

For example, people who bitch about getting gangbanged in the wild shouldn’t be able to bitch about it over global, seeing it’s not the appropriate medium and causes all sorts of trouble. Meanwhile, someone who just got scammed by a popular member should be able to communicate it through global chat.

[quote=“Lothy, post:9, topic:526436”]EDIT: That, or you could just make the ignore list functional for global chat as well.[/quote]That solves an entirely different problem of people harassing others via global chat. It doesn’t really remove people who just use global chat to constantly bitch about things.

item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

I think global chat is one of those things that grows more important as the game’s population density decreases. I wouldn’t put a price on it because then you effectively lock newcomers out of it.

Perhaps player-based moderation would be key. Players, if they come across a spammer, can enter a command to vote in favour of banning him. If a certain percentage of online players vote in favour of the ban then the spammer is muted temporarily (perhaps 30 to 60 minutes). The mute could apply to the logged in account only, every player account associated with the person’s forum account, or even the IP address.
There’s the risk of abuse I suppose, but that’s always the case with ‘mark as spam’ approaches. Even if there is a miscarriage of justice though, it would be short-lived. And if certain people were obviously being victimised then perhaps some sort of exemption could be applied to their account.

item.title: Commands
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“matty matt, post:3, topic:526436”]+1 global chat because it is the best form of communication. Also, you could put a filter on just the ::Say command as i have in my server. Other useful commands are fatigue, and skull.[/quote]What type of filter? A filter that removes bad words is utterly useless, because it takes less than 2 seconds for someone to bypass it, which shows everyone else how to bypass it. Meanwhile, you’re going to be censoring legitimate words and all the bullshit/drama is still going to get through.
[hr]

[quote=“Methods, post:4, topic:526436”][quote author=waj link=topic=645183.msg4340171#msg4340171 date=1375056759]

What commands does everyone think are needed in a server?

Also, what does everyone think about global chat? Should there be a ::say command that everyone can use freely? Should people need to spend GP for each message? What do you guys think would be a good way to curb all the stupid shit that is said in global chat? Should there even be global chat?

Global Chat:

Yeah, I’d have it, its a very good way of communication across the game imo.

As for limiting the bullshit and spam, I think there should be some restrictions should as combat level, that’ll at least stop random people logging in and trying to cause crap on low levels.
[/quote]

…or just use the already implemented skill total requirement to use ::say[/quote]IDK what source you’re using, but there is no skill total requirement already implemented on MoparClassic.

Also, how does that stop the bullshit? Everyone who has played for a decent amount of time will meet the requirement, meanwhile you’re blocking new players from using it to get help.
